summary.para: Gets the result of a time-based seek.

param.name: pqwStartTime
param.para: Receives the new position after the seek, in 100-nanosecond units.

param.name: pqwStopTime
param.para: Receives the stop time, in 100-nanosecond units. If the stop time is unknown, the value is zero.

param.name: pqwDuration
param.para: Receives the total duration of the file, in 100-nanosecond units. If the duration is unknown, the value is –1.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The byte stream does not support time-based seeking, or no data is available.

remarks.para: This method returns the server response from a previous time-based seek.
Note This method normally cannot be invoked until some data is read from the byte stream, because the method does not send a server request immediately.

summary.para: Queries whether the byte stream supports time-based seeking.

param.name: pfTimeSeekIsSupported
param.para: Receives the value TRUE if the byte stream supports time-based seeking, or FALSE otherwise.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Seeks to a new position in the byte stream.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If the byte stream reads from a server, it might cache the seek request until the next read request. Therefore, the byte stream might not send a request to the server immediately.

summary.para: Seeks a byte stream by time position.

remarks.para: A byte stream can implement this interface if it supports time-based seeking. For example, a byte stream that reads data from a server might implement the interface. Typically, a local file-based byte stream would not implement it.
To get a pointer to this interface, call on the byte stream object.
